items.preText: Soumya and Tamim are headed out to the middle as are the South African team. Tamim will face the first ball. His wrist must be OK. Lungi Ngidi has the new ball. Here we go. 10.22am The teams are out on the ground for the anthems. News from the South African camp regarding Hashim Amla's health. Proteas team manager, Dr Mohammed Moosajee explained: "Hashim hasn't fully recovered from the blow sustained to the helmet during the match against England on Thursday and is not available for selection for the match today. With the quick turnaround between the two matches, he is being rested as a precaution, based on our post-match re-assessment. We are hopeful that he will make a full recovery to be available for selection for our next match against India." 10.15am The pitch is the same one that was used in the England South Africa tournament opener. Pace and bounce is expected but there should be runs on offer. nafiz: "SA to bowl first. By using extra pace Du plessis means a bouncer barrage. Lets see what our top 3 is made of" Takks Mota Musi: "Bating top Shakib Vs Tahir.. where Tahir has dismissed Shakib three times in less than 10 overs. " Karthik: "Both teams have same green colour Jersey is there any changes in Jersey colour for today . Heard every team is having two different coloured Jersey, is that so" South Africa will wear their yellow top with green pants. 10.00am Toss: South Africa have won the toss and will bowl first . Teams - Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Mohammad Mithun, Mahmudullah, Mosaddek Hossain, Mohammad Saifuddin, Mehedi Hasan, Mashrafe Mortaza (c), Mustafizur Rahman South Africa: Quinton de Kock (wk), Aiden Markram, Faf du Plessis (c), Rassie van der Dussen, David Miller, JP Duminy, Andile Phehlukwayo, Chris Morris, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi, Imran Tahir Faf du Plessis: "We're playing the extra seamer today so we want to try and attack Bangladesh with some extra pace. We want to take the learnings from the previous game. I thought he did really well to restrict a strong England batting line-up. Today we are playing a slightly different team. Obviously Hashim Amla got hit on the head so David Miller comes back in and then the other change is Chris Morris, we're trying to get some extra pace with this wicket. There was a bit of extra bounce and we're trying to make use of that." Mashrafe Mortaza: "I'm fine. We are pretty confident. We've had a good preparation. It's a used wicket. It should be good to bat on. Depends on how we bat. Everyone is fit to play. Tamim is fit." Bangladesh have dropped Sabbir, and brought in Mosaddek Hossain, who struck a 23-ball fifty in the tri-series final on May 17. Farook: "BCCI requested ICC to delay India's first match so that India will get 15 days gap between IPL & WC.. " Nitish R: "Glad to see M&M (Miller and Morris) back for SA. They were very much missed in the previous game. South Africa's yellow (away) jersey gives a very refreshing look. Hope they go on to give a refreshing performance. Teams chasing have won 3 games on the trot. SA can keep the streak alive today. " Istiak : "BD team missed the opportunity to include inform Liton Das. They could have included him instead of Mithun. Das have the power and technique to be a finisher as well. GOOD LUCK BD TIGERS" 9.55am Toss is coming shortly. We'll get news on whethere Tamim is playing. Conditions are nice today in London. Aupi: "This is Bangladesh's best WC side and we're all expecting big things from them. We weren't able to see how big a score they could make during the tri nations in Ireland as they were able to achieve their targets with overs to spare. The warmup against India was missing Tamim but then again, it was just a warm up. Looking forward to the match against SA. Should be a good one." Saeed Rasul: "Alex, the other eight teams have already played one match each. Shouldn't today's match be between Bangladesh & India?" It is a strange quirk of the fixtures. I'm not sure of the reason. 9.45am Liam Brickhill is on the Live Report for us as well today. Abhijato: "In each of the four WC matches so far, we have seen world-class execution of skills on one side, and nerves which prevented the opposition from doing the same. Hence, we haven't yet seen The Quintessential Thriller (TQT) we were told to expect many of in this format. However, as the context laid out for this match by the ever wonderful Liam Brickhill shows, both these teams are far from pushovers. I, for one, will keep a close eye on the score, for this might be our first T.Q.T.!" Manish T: "SA tail is too long. Not sure why David Miller and Chris Morris (the designated finishers) were not in playing XI in the first match. They surely need them. The top order and bowling is very good, if they can get the middle order right, SA have a good chance." Vinod Rajpal: "Good Morning Alex,Can Amla get to 8000 runs in ODI cricket with just 77 more - and if he reaches the milestone, beating Virat Kohli (175 innings). Amla was also the fastest to 2k to 7k !!" Shakib Al Hasan also needs one wicket to become fastest to 250 wickets and 5000 runs in ODIs. Imran Tahir is playing his 100th ODI today. 9.30am Hello and welcome to the Oval for this vital clash between South Africa and Bangladesh. South Africa need to rebound quickly after losing to England in the opening match here at the Oval. Bangladesh are playing their first match of the tournament. Alex Malcolm in commentary with you today. Shashank Kishore will also be along for this one. Here is Liam Brickhill's preview. While we wait for the toss you must read Nagraj Gollapudi's conversation with Kagiso Rabada. Mohammad Isam has also done a great piece with Rubel Hossain. Mohammad Isam is at the Oval for us today: "A Bangladesh majority among the spectators, they are slowly coming in. A bright and sunny day mostly with a hint of breeze." Tamim Iqbal isn't sure to start given injury concerns with his wrist, but if he does, he should be in all your fantasy XIs. Who else should get in, especially budget buys who could give you a competitive edge? The latest on our World Cup fantasy blog Mahneel: "Super exciting times for us Bangladeshis back home. The streets have started becoming thinner as thousands flock indoors to witness Bangladesh's first match in this World Cup. #FingersCrossed" Mark: "Four matches. In all four the side batting first has struggled, with England the only winners. It makes me think that if Bangladesh win the Toss and chase, we could have the somewhat ridiculous situation that South Africa are half way out of the tournament with two losses before all ten sides have even played a game."
items.text: 137kph, good length angled across and he plays well inside the line to let it go
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length, 138kph, on middle, he neatly tucks this off the back foot to fine leg
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Salin: "BD gotta start watchfully. SA will definitely try so many short balls against Tamim and Soumya. Hope this pair can BD a good start. Looking forward to seeing Soumya go hard against SA pace attack."
items.text: 138kph, good length, he pushes forward and nudges this to cover-point
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: thick inside edge goes past leg stump! He was trying to cut but it was a touch too close but the inside edge bounces safely past leg stump
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: flicked off the hip over square leg! It was just an awkward jabbed pull that just cleared the infield and it bounced hard off the wide square and raced away
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length, off  stump, he defends with soft hands into the off side
items.shortText: Ngidi to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: 139kph, shorter ball, rising into the ribs and he's back and jumping to knock this down
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: The Proteas keen to use pace early
items.text: fuller and swinging down the leg side
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.preText: A touch of swing back into the left-handers for Rabada. He bailed out of the next delivery after it slipped from his hand as he ran in
items.text: fuller on off, he drives but mistimes back to the bowler
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 140kph, good length, swinging back in, takes him on the thigh pad, hint of shape
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 139kph bouncer, this flies way over his head, he ducked under it easily. No wide call. Plenty of bounce and pace though
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shorter on the hip, it comes off the thigh guard as he tries to glance
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: he drives a fuller ball, slicing it off a thick edge towards third man
items.postText: Mohammad Isam: "Tamim was injured in the first game of the Asia Cup, and then had to bat one-handed towards the end of that innings against Sri Lanka, but then missed out on the rest of the tournament. This was in UAE last year. He was struck on the back hand by Suranga Lakmal. He is playing with another injury on the same wrist today."
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: beaten, prodding at a cracking delivery that nipped off the seam outside off
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 137kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending with the full face
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 140kph, slightly over-pitched and he leans into a well controlled cover drive into the gap. Nice stroke, didn't over hit it
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: 141kph, fuller outside off, he drives harder but gets it off a thick inside towards square leg
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 135kph, play and miss trying to drive on the up as it zipped past the edge
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: fuller again, 140kph, he drives but doesn't time it, picking out cover-point
items.postText: Mukul : "BD really seems to find it hard to rotate." It's nipping around and there is some swing. Not easy batting so far.
items.shortText: Ngidi to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: 141kph, shorter length, he's back and opening the face and running this to third man
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: 140kph, good length, hint of shape back, he works this neatly to the gap at wide mid on
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: 145kph, wider, not a half-volley, he frees the arms to drive but mistimes to mid off
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Mohsin Reza: "A steady and watchful start is all Bangladesh required and that is what they are doing. Playing according to plan. May be mine "
items.text: 142kph, fuller and swinging into the pads, it runs towards fine leg for a leg bye
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, 1 leg bye

items.text: 145kph, fuller outside off, he tries a big expansive drive, gets a thick inside edge that runs behind square for a couple
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: 144kph, good length, angled across and he's happy to leave this alone
items.shortText: Rabada to Tamim Iqbal, no run
